**Difficult Path to U.S. Through One Family’s Eyes**

With three children and a dog, the Aquila Oranges family trekked through Central America, trudged through the jungle, looped freight trains, and finally reached New York City. Squished challenges still lie ahead. Page A10.

**PLATFORM Eases Abortion Stand To Suit Trump**

**Document Cements His Control of G.O.P.**

This article is by Maggie Horner, Shane Golenchar and Jonathan Stein.

Donald J. Trump still officials on Monday that he supports a new Republican Party platform, one that reflects his own position on abortion rights and aims down policy specifics across all areas of government.

The new platform, as described to The New York Times by people briefed on it, cement the Trump’s ideological leaner of the G.O.P. The platform is even more nonpartisan, more protectionist and less socially conservative than the 2016 Republican platform that was duplicated in its 2020 election.

Mr. Trump, who has had the draft he served during his eight years of party officials who do not support abortion, has said that he served quietly as a “very good” vice presidential candidate. The document accurately lays out the party’s position on Monday, passing 14 to 10, according to a person briefed on the matter.

The abortion section has been softened. There is no longer a reference to “traditional marriage” as between the two and one woman.” And there is no longer an emphasis on reducing the national debt, only to refer to an asset “slashing, wasteful government spending.”

The rest of the document reflects Mr. Trump’s priorities as outlined on his campaign website: a hard-line stance on immigration, taxing corporations, a pro-life stance on abortion, and a focus on the rights of the unborn. The document also includes a list of issues that the party will not support, including abortion, abortion rights, and the right to an abortion.

Mr. Trump and his top aides have said they are committed to “protecting the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and, and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and the Constitution and

**REPLYING TO EXIT, BIDEN DENOUNCES CRITICS IN PARTY**

IN A LETTER AND ON TV

**Firey Reply to Doubts: ‘Challenge Me at the Convention’**

**By MICHAEL D. SHEAR**

WASHINGTON — President Biden on Monday derided critics over a draft of a message to the country that he said was “not on the right course,” echoing the same sentiment in a different letter to Democrats. The letter, which was sent in fiery remarks on MSNBC’s “Fox & Friends” program.

**Moscow Unleashes a Bite Across Ukraine, Killing at Least 38**

The Ukrainian Air Force said it shot down 30 out of the 38 missiles launched by Russia during the attack, which began in the early hours of the day.

The attack was massive, combined with the use of aerial, ballistic and cruise missiles,” said Svetlana Poltoratska, the deputy head of the Kyiv military command. “The missiles fell for at least 30 seconds, and from different directions.”
